content:
Both Disney+ and HBO Max have an impressive collection of classic sci-fi films. Here are some recommendations that are currently available to stream on these platforms:

**Disney+:**

1. **20,000 Leagues Under the Sea** (1954) - A classic adaptation of Jules Verne's novel, starring Kirk Douglas and James Mason.
2. **The Black Hole** (1979) - A Disney-produced sci-fi epic about a group of astronauts who discover a black hole.
3. **The Last Flight of Noah's Ark** (1980) - A family-friendly adventure film about a group of animals who escape from a zoo and travel through time.
4. **Flight of the Navigator** (1986) - A beloved sci-fi comedy about a young boy who befriends an alien spaceship.
5. **The Black Cauldron** (1985) - An animated fantasy film set in a mystical land, featuring a mix of sci-fi and fantasy elements.

**HBO Max:**

1. **2001: A Space Odyssey** (1968) - A groundbreaking and influential sci-fi classic by Stanley Kubrick.
2. **Forbidden Planet** (1956) - A classic sci-fi film about a team of astronauts who investigate a mysterious planet.
3. **The Time Machine** (1960) - An adaptation of H.G. Wells' novel, starring Rod Taylor as a time traveler.
4. **The Omega Man** (1971) - A post-apocalyptic sci-fi film starring Charlton Heston as the last man on earth.
5. **Colossus: The Forbin Project** (1970) - A sci-fi thriller about a team of scientists who create a supercomputer that becomes self-aware.

Please note that availability may vary depending on your region and the streaming services available in your area. Enjoy your classic sci-fi movie marathon!
